BodyText.SourceString:
Press "{0}" to enter vehicles. 

You must be standing outside the seat you’d like to enter. 

From inside the vehicle you can change seats by pressing "{1}", "{2}", "{3}" etc. Switching seats doesn’t necessarily work for all seats in every vehicle.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Press "{0}" to enter vehicles. 

You must be standing outside the seat you’d like to enter. 

From inside the vehicle you can change seats by pressing "{1}", "{2}", "{3}" etc. Switching seats doesn’t necessarily work for all seats in every vehicle.

BodyText.SourceString:
To fuel a vehicle, first refine or acquire diesel or petrol. For training purposes, you can find some in the Storage Box next to the nearby house. 

Press "{0}" to open your inventory and click "{1}" on the fuel to equip it. 

Once equipped, close the menu, approach a vehicle and hold down "{1}" until you are out of fuel.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
To fuel a vehicle, first refine or acquire diesel or petrol. For training purposes, you can find some in the Storage Box next to the nearby house. 

Press "{0}" to open your inventory and click "{1}" on the fuel to equip it. 

Once equipped, close the menu, approach a vehicle and hold down "{1}" until you are out of fuel.

BodyText.SourceString:
Some vehicles have armaments that can be used with your team to wreak havoc on your opponents. 

As a gunner, you must have ammo in your vehicle's inventory in order to reload with "{0}". Try using the Armored Car with a partner to get accustomed to the gunner’s position. 

Each vehicle in Foxhole has different functions. If you’re unsure how something works, don’t be afraid to ask.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Some vehicles have armaments that can be used with your team to wreak havoc on your opponents. 

As a gunner, you must have ammo in your inventory in order to reload with "{0}". Try using the Armored Car with a partner to get accustomed to the gunner’s position. 

Each vehicle in Foxhole has different functions. If you’re unsure how something works, don’t be afraid to ask.

BodyText.SourceString:
The driving course is intended to for you to practice basic driving controls. For training purposes, we have provided a selection of vehicles. 

Use "{0}", "{1}", "{2}", "{3}" to control your vehicle just as you move on foot.

Press "{4}" for handbrake.

Handle your speed carefully and feather the throttle as you bank into turns. 

There are targets scattered around the course to practice aiming while on in the sidecar of the motorcycle or with the Armored Car. Aiming in a vehicle is also the same. 

In a gunner position/sidecar hold "{5}" to aim and "{6}" to shoot.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
The driving course is intended to for you to practice basic driving controls. For training purposes, we have provided a selection of vehicles. 

Use "{0}", "{1}", "{2}", "{3}" to control your vehicle just as you move on foot.

Press "{4}" for handbrake.

Handle your speed carefully and feather the throttle as you bank into turns. 

There are targets scattered around the course to practice aiming while on in the sidecar of the motorcycle or with the Armored Car. Aiming in a vehicle is also the same. 

In a gunner position/sidecar hold "{5}" to aim and "{6}" to shoot.

BodyText.SourceString:
All vehicles are manufactured by players. For training purposes, in the nearby Storage Container, we’ve provided everything you need to build a transport truck. 

Press "{0}" while inside the Vehicle Factory to open the production menu and select ‘Transport’.

A blueprint will appear. 

With basic materials in your inventory and your hammer equipped (press "{1}") step up to the blueprint and press "{2}". This will contribute one material to the project. Repeat until the truck is constructed.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
All vehicles are manufactured by players. For training purposes, in the nearby Storage Container, we’ve provided everything you need to build a transport truck. 

Press "{0}" while inside the Vehicle Factory to open the production menu and select ‘Transport’.

A blueprint will appear. 

With basic materials in your inventory and your hammer equipped (press "{1}") step up to the blueprint and press "{2}". This will contribute one material to the project. Repeat until the truck is constructed.

BodyText.SourceString:
When using Artillery, you will have control over heading and distance.

NOTE: Turning requires two players be mounted.

Press "{0}" to mount.

On the right, Use "{1}" to affect distance. On the left, "{2}" and "{3}" will change azimuth. 

On the right, when your target is confirmed press "{4}" to fire.

There is a catch, you’ll need a third player to spot for you, using binoculars. Binoculars don't reach the same distances as the Artillery, so coordination with your spotter is a must in order to get an accurate reading. 

Have your spotter range ahead, and communicate with them to determine whether or not you’ve hit your target.

Binoculars are provided for training in the nearby storage box.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
When using Artillery, you will have control over heading and distance.

NOTE: Turning requires two players be mounted.

Press "{0}" to mount.

On the right, Use "{1}" to affect distance. On the left, "{2}" and "{3}" will change azimuth. 

On the right, when your target is confirmed press "{4}" to fire.

There is a catch, you’ll need a third player to spot for you, using binoculars. Binoculars don't reach the same distances as the Artillery, so coordination with your spotter is a must in order to get an accurate reading. 

Have your spotter range ahead, and communicate with them to determine whether or not you’ve hit your target.

Binoculars are provided for training in the nearby storage box.

BodyText.SourceString:
Artillery Ammo is a Large Object and must be physically carried to your Artillery to reload. 

Press "{0}" to load the shell when standing near your Artillery.

You’ll know you’re close enough when the prompt appears in the bottom left.

Artillery shells are provided in the nearby storage box.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Artillery Ammo is a Large Object and must be physically carried to your Artillery to reload. 

Press "{0}" to load the shell when standing near your Artillery.

You’ll know you’re close enough when the prompt appears in the bottom left.

Artillery shells are provided in the nearby storage box.

ActionNames: Pick Up, Drop, Or Submit Large Item

BodyText.SourceString:
Resources are used to manufacture everything, from ammunition to medical supplies and tanks.

Equip your Hammer and use "{0}" on scrap piles. Harvesters can also be used to procure resources. Components and Sulfur require a Sledgehammer to gather which have been provided in a Storage Box nearby.

Each item requires different materials to manufacture, but must first be refined.

Try gathering some materials—which can be found ahead—loading them in one of the trucks provided then bringing them over to the refinery next to you.

There you’ll also find a factory where you can make use of some of your newly refined materials.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Resources are used to manufacture everything, from ammunition to medical supplies and tanks.

Equip your Hammer and use "{0}" on scrap piles. Harvesters can also be used to procure resources. Components and Sulfur require a Sledgehammer to gather which have been provided in a Storage Box nearby.

Each item requires different materials to manufacture, but must first be refined.

Try gathering some materials—which can be found ahead—loading them in one of the trucks provided then bringing them over to the refinery next to you.

There you’ll also find a factory where you can make use of some of your newly refined materials.

BodyText.SourceString:
Occasionally, you will discover other materials while mining resources, such as Iron or Aluminum.

These resources can be refined into Alloys, which can then be submitted to the Engineering Center in your rear-line logistics towns for research toward new weapons and vehicles.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Occasionally, you will discover other materials while mining resources, such as Iron or Aluminum.

These resources can be refined into Alloys, which can then be submitted to the Engineering Center in your rear-line logistics towns for research toward new weapons and vehicles.

BodyText.SourceString:
The Refinery will convert scrap and other raw resources into materials which can be used to produce items, vehicles, and structures. 

For a more detailed explanation click the “?” icon in the top right corner of the Refinery menu.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
The Refinery will convert scrap and other raw resources into materials which can be used to produce items, vehicles, and structures. 

For a more detailed explanation click the “?” icon in the top right corner of the Refinery menu.

BodyText.SourceString:
Factories are used to manufacture various items. 

Feel free to use the factory nearby. 

If you need resources, try refining materials which can be gathered at one of the various nodes on the island. 

For a more detailed explanation click the “?” icon in the top right corner of the Factory menu.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Factories are used to manufacture various items. 

Feel free to use the factory nearby. 

If you need resources, try refining materials which can be gathered at one of the various nodes on the island. 

For a more detailed explanation click the “?” icon in the top right corner of the Factory menu.

BodyText.SourceString:
Press "{0}" with a hammer equipped to open the build menu.

After selecting structure, a blueprint will appear at your mouse pointer. 

Hold "{1}" while moving your mouse to rotate the blueprint, and "{2}" to place the blueprint.

Once placed, use "{2}" with your hammer to deposit materials until structure is complete. 

Try building a ‘Watch Tower’ in the dirt in front of you. 

Multiple soldiers can collaborate on building any given blueprint. 

Some surfaces, such as the gravel behind you, or sand, may not be suitable for building, but some structures have fewer restrictions, such as sandbags.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Press "{0}" with a hammer equipped to open the build menu.

After selecting structure, a blueprint will appear at your mouse pointer. 

Hold "{1}" while moving your mouse to rotate the blueprint, and "{2}" to place the blueprint.

Once placed, use "{2}" with your hammer to deposit materials until structure is complete. 

Try building a ‘Watch Tower’ in the dirt in front of you. 

Multiple soldiers can collaborate on building any given blueprint. 

Some surfaces, such as the gravel behind you, or sand, may not be suitable for building, but some structures have fewer restrictions, such as sandbags.

BodyText.SourceString:
The Storage Facility is, as its name implies, a structure for storing items and vehicles for later use. 

You can submit crates of items, vehicles or shipping containers. 

For a more detailed explanation click the ‘?’ icon in the top right corner of the Storage Facility menu.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
The Storage Facility is, as its name implies, a structure for storing items and vehicles for later use. 

You can submit crates of items, vehicles or shipping containers. 

For a more detailed explanation click the ‘?’ icon in the top right corner of the Storage Facility menu.

BodyText.SourceString:
The Construction Yard is used to build Shipping Containers. 

Shipping Containers can be filled with items and moved long distances using a flatbed truck. 

To move shipping containers they first must be packaged, and then transported short distances with a crane.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
The Construction Yard is used to build Shipping Containers. 

Shipping Containers can be filled with items and moved long distances using a flatbed truck. 

To move shipping containers they first must be packaged, and then transported short distances with a crane.

BodyText.SourceString:
Welcome to basic logistics training. 

Here you’ll be able to interact with various structures in the game. 

Press "{0}" to interact with every structure. This will open their unique menu as well as their inventory. 

If you are confused as to how to use a structure, click on the ‘?’ in the top right corner of the menu pane for more information. Don’t be afraid to ask around!
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Welcome to basic logistics training. 

Here you’ll be able to interact with various structures in the game. 

Press "{0}" to interact with every structure. This will open their unique menu as well as their inventory. 

If you are confused as to how to use a structure, click on the ‘?’ in the top right corner of the menu pane for more information. Don’t be afraid to ask around!

BodyText.SourceString:
Resources can also be acquired through mining.

Mines require fuel to operate and will automatically generate resources over time. 

Which type of fuel you use determines the mine’s effeciency. 

For training purposes, fuel has been provided in a Storage Box nearby. 

For more information, click on the ‘?’ icon in the corner of the Mine menu.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Resources can also be acquired through mining.

Mines require fuel to operate and will automatically generate resources over time. 

Which type of fuel you use determines the mine’s effeciency. 

For training purposes, fuel has been provided in a Storage Box nearby. 

For more information, click on the ‘?’ icon in the corner of the Mine menu.

BodyText.SourceString:
Fuel can be acquired in two ways. 

First, you can refine scrap into Diesel.

Second, using Diesel to fuel Oil Wells, which will produce Oil Barrels. Barrels can then be refined into Petrol. 

Petrol can also be used to produce Barrels at a higher efficency.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Fuel can be acquired in two ways. 

First, you can refine scrap into Diesel.

Second, using Diesel to fuel Oil Wells, which will produce Oil Barrels. Barrels can then be refined into Petrol. 

Petrol can also be used to produce Barrels at a higher efficency.

BodyText.SourceString:
Welcome to basic training. 

Here you can practice the various basic tools needed to be successful on the front line.
"{0}", "{1}", "{2}", "{3}"
Follow the course ahead to get started. Signs along the way will explain basic controls and functionality.

If you have questions about anything, don’t be afraid to ask in chat.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Welcome to basic training. 

Here you can practice the various basic tools needed to be successful on the front line.
"{0}", "{1}", "{2}", "{3}"
Follow the course ahead to get started. Signs along the way will explain basic controls and functionality.

If you have questions about anything, don’t be afraid to ask in chat.

BodyText.SourceString:
Press "{0}" to sprint. 

If you get lost, open the map with "{1}". While in the map screen, zoom with the 'Mouse Wheel' and click to drag the map around.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Press "{0}" to sprint. 

If you get lost, open the map with "{1}". While in the map screen, zoom with the 'Mouse Wheel' and click to drag the map around.

BodyText.SourceString: To rotate the camera, hold "{0}" while moving the mouse left and right.
BodyText.LocalizedString: To rotate the camera, hold "{0}" while moving the mouse left and right.

BodyText.SourceString:
Before continuing your training, make sure to set your spawn point at the Forward Base ahead. 

Press "{0}" to interact with the Base. Here you’ll see its inventory and various options to upgrade/manage the base. Ignore those for now.

Click the flashing ‘house’ icon that reads, ‘Assign spawn point.’

For more information, click on the ‘?’ icon in the corner of the Outpost menu.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Before continuing your training, make sure to set your spawn point at the Forward Base ahead. 

Press "{0}" to interact with the Base. Here you’ll see its inventory and various options to upgrade/manage the base. Ignore those for now.

Click the flashing ‘house’ icon that reads, ‘Assign spawn point.’

For more information, click on the ‘?’ icon in the corner of the Outpost menu.

BodyText.SourceString:
Make sure you load the Forward Base with soldier supplies. 

For training purposes, you can find some in these Storage Crates. 

You can open containers by pressing "{0}".

"{1}" to pull a single item, ‘SHIFT+LMB’ to pull the entire stack.

‘RMB’ opens a context menu.

‘CTRL’ + ‘LMB’ to split a stack in half.

‘ALT’ + ‘LMB’ to drop the item.

These are the same controls for putting items from your backpack into another structure or container, which you’ll need to do with these soldier supplies in the Forward Base ahead.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Make sure you load the Forward Base with soldier supplies. 

For training purposes, you can find some in these Storage Crates. 

You can open containers by pressing "{0}".

"{1}" to pull a single item, ‘SHIFT+LMB’ to pull the entire stack.

‘RMB’ opens a context menu.

‘CTRL’ + ‘LMB’ to split a stack in half.

‘ALT’ + ‘LMB’ to drop the item.

These are the same controls for putting items from your backpack into another structure or container, which you’ll need to do with these soldier supplies in the Forward Base ahead.

BodyText.SourceString: Press "{0}" to vault over low cover, such as sandbags or to climb low fences and walls.
BodyText.LocalizedString: Press "{0}" to vault over low cover, such as sandbags or to climb low fences and walls.

BodyText.SourceString:
Just like vaulting, press "{0}" to mount a ladder. 

Press "{1}" or "{2}" to move up or down.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Just like vaulting, press "{0}" to mount a ladder. 

Press "{1}" or "{2}" to move up or down.

BodyText.SourceString:
For training purposes, a variety of firearms have been provided in the nearby Storage Containers. Normally, all weapons must be manufactured.

To assign a weapon to its corresponding slot, open your inventory with "{0}" and click the desired weapon. 

Once assigned, close your backpack and equip the weapon with "{1}" if it is a primary or "{2}" if it is a secondary weapon.

Aim by holding "{3}" and while holding it down, fire using "{4}".

Try practicing on these targets.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
For training purposes, a variety of firearms have been provided in the nearby Storage Containers. Normally, all weapons must be manufactured.

To assign a weapon to its corresponding slot, open your inventory with "{0}" and click the desired weapon. 

Once assigned, close your backpack and equip the weapon with "{1}" if it is a primary or "{2}" if it is a secondary weapon.

Aim by holding "{3}" and while holding it down, fire using "{4}".

Try practicing on these targets.

BodyText.SourceString:
Welcome to the Gun Range. 

Here you can practice the fundamentals of gunplay and combat.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Welcome to the Gun Range. 

Here you can practice the fundamentals of gunplay and combat.

BodyText.SourceString:
Grenades are equipped from your inventory, just like any other weapon, into the tertiary weapon slot. 

Equip with "{0}".

Grenades are thrown in an arc, which you can visualise while aiming with "{1}". 

Hold "{2}" to cook your grenade, and release when ready to throw.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Grenades are equipped from your inventory, just like any other weapon, into the tertiary weapon slot. 

Equip with "{0}".

Grenades are thrown in an arc, which you can visualise while aiming with "{1}". 

Hold "{2}" to cook your grenade, and release when ready to throw.

BodyText.SourceString:
Ammo is sectioned off into individual magazines. 

Be careful not to carry too many, it can get heavy and, if you’re not paying attention, wasteful. 

Once you reload with "{0}", you discard your old magazine, so only reload when absolutely necessary.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Ammo is sectioned off into individual magazines. 

Be careful not to carry too many, it can get heavy and, if you’re not paying attention, wasteful. 

Once you reload with "{0}", you discard your old magazine, so only reload when absolutely necessary.

BodyText.SourceString:
Keep an eye on your crosshairs. When they’re close together, you have a much greater chance of hitting your target. 

Every shot will reduce stability.

There are three ways to increase stability. 

One, standing still while firing.

Two, crouching with "{0}".

Three, going prone with "{1}"

Being prone gives you the greatest stability, but at the cost of mobility.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Keep an eye on your crosshairs. When they’re close together, you have a much greater chance of hitting your target. 

Every shot will reduce stability.

There are three ways to increase stability. 

One, standing still while firing.

Two, crouching with "{0}".

Three, going prone with "{1}"

Being prone gives you the greatest stability, but at the cost of mobility.

BodyText.SourceString:
Change stances into a crouch "{0}" or prone "{1}" to reduce your profile and increase stability. 

Practice moving while crouched or prone in the course ahead.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Change stances into a crouch "{0}" or prone "{1}" to reduce your profile and increase stability. 

Practice moving while crouched or prone in the course ahead.

BodyText.SourceString:
There are three types of Medical gear.

Equip the bandages in your inventory and press "{2}" to select it. Apply Bandages to yourself to stop bleeding. The bandage is consumed. 

First Aid Kits heal wounds and require bandages. 

Trauma Kits heal critical wounds and require Blood Plasma.

Equip and use them as you would a weapon.

Trauma Kits and First Aid Kits can only be used on other soldiers.

To help a Wounded comrade when you have no supplies, press "{0}" on their Wounded body to carry them to safety. Press "{1}" to drop them in front of a medic.

Critically Wounded soldiers can be picked up with "{0}" then loaded onto an ambulance or treated at a Hospital or Field Hospital.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
There are three types of Medical gear.

Equip the bandages in your inventory and press "{2}" to select it. Apply Bandages to yourself to stop bleeding. The bandage is consumed. 

First Aid Kits heal wounds and require bandages. 

Trauma Kits heal critical wounds and require Blood Plasma.

Equip and use them as you would a weapon.

Trauma Kits and First Aid Kits can only be used on other soldiers.

To help a Wounded comrade when you have no supplies, press "{0}" on their Wounded body to carry them to safety. Press "{1}" to drop them in front of a medic.

Critically Wounded soldiers can be picked up with "{0}" then loaded onto an ambulance or treated at a Hospital or Field Hospital.

ActionNames: Pick Up, Drop, Or Submit Large Item

BodyText.SourceString:
This course is designed to test you.

Grab a friend and ask them to shoot at you while you move from cover to cover. Take shots at them along the way. 

See if you can hit all the targets as you make your way through.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
This course is designed to test you.

Grab a friend and ask them to shoot at you while you move from cover to cover. Take shots at them along the way. 

See if you can hit all the targets as you make your way through.

BodyText.SourceString:
Visibility is an important consideration when navigating the battlefield. 

Anything your character can't see, will become invisible on screen. 

Hiding in grass, behind walls, and bushes are all useful options for a stealthy approach. Moving while hidden will expose you and if you are hiding near an enemy soldier in the same bush, or inside smoke, you may still be able to see one another. 

Try testing the results with other soldiers in the grass ahead.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Visibility is an important consideration when navigating the battlefield. 

Anything your character can't see, will become invisible on screen. 

Hiding in grass, behind walls, and bushes are all useful options for a stealthy approach. Moving while hidden will expose you and if you are hiding near an enemy soldier in the same bush, or inside smoke, you may still be able to see one another. 

Try testing the results with other soldiers in the grass ahead.

BodyText.SourceString:
With all that gear, swimming is difficult and takes tons of energy. 

You can't make it very far without drowning so watch your stamina. Once it runs out, you will die. 

With full stamina, try to swim to the ladders on the opposite side, and press "{0}" to climb up to the dock.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
With all that gear, swimming is difficult and takes tons of energy. 

You can't make it very far without drowning so watch your stamina. Once it runs out, you will die. 

With full stamina, try to swim to the ladders on the opposite side, and press "{0}" to climb up to the dock.

BodyText.SourceString:
On top of providing protection, using cover will give you a boost to stability. 

Keep an eye on the shield at the bottom of the screen. Depending on how deep in cover you are will determine the boost.

If you are fired on, you will eventually become Suppressed, which will reduce and eventually negate the stability boost. Being suppressed out in the open will negatively impact your stability.

You can suppress structures by firing at them which will slow or stop their rate of fire, as well as prevent players inside them from shooting out. 

Test out cover on the different parts of the wall in front of you. Try shooting the pillbox until the flag flashes white, indicating that it is suppressed.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
On top of providing protection, using cover will give you a boost to stability. 

Keep an eye on the shield at the bottom of the screen. Depending on how deep in cover you are will determine the boost.

If you are fired on, you will eventually become Suppressed, which will reduce and eventually negate the stability boost. Being suppressed out in the open will negatively impact your stability.

You can suppress structures by firing at them which will slow or stop their rate of fire, as well as prevent players inside them from shooting out. 

Test out cover on the different parts of the wall in front of you. Try shooting the pillbox until the flag flashes white, indicating that it is suppressed.

BodyText.SourceString:
To start a trench, first you need a shovel. Find some in one of the nearby storage containers. 

With a shovel equipped, press "{0}" to open the build menu.

Make your selection and, when starting a new trench, place the plot like any other structure. 

Once you’ve placed a plot, hold "{1}" to dig. 

This will take some time, but digging trenches is easier with a crew.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
To start a trench, first you need a shovel. Find some in one of the nearby storage containers. 

With a shovel equipped, press "{0}" to open the build menu.

Make your selection and, when starting a new trench, place the plot like any other structure. 

Once you’ve placed a plot, hold "{1}" to dig. 

This will take some time, but digging trenches is easier with a crew.

BodyText.SourceString:
Once you have an initial Trench or Bunker in place, further trenches or bunkers will snap to different sections. 

Try snapping new trenches to the different sides of the initial one. 

To make a “T” shaped trench, rotate your blueprint on the long-side of a trench. 

Connect new bunkers by simply snapping new sections.

Trenches can be extended from Bunkers as well. 

Hold “Shift” to break snapping.

Separate trench lines can be connected using a Trench Connector.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Once you have an initial Trench or Bunker in place, further trenches or bunkers will snap to different sections. 

Try snapping new trenches to the different sides of the initial one. 

To make a “T” shaped trench, rotate your blueprint on the long-side of a trench. 

Connect new bunkers by simply snapping new sections.

Trenches can be extended from Bunkers as well. 

Hold “Shift” to break snapping.

Separate trench lines can be connected using a Trench Connector.

BodyText.SourceString:
First, build a fresh Trench and attach a Bunker.

Equip a hammer, then walk up to the Bunker. Facing the wall, press "{0}". 

You should see a menu with new options.

You can upgrade your Bunker in a variety of different ways. Convert it into AI defenses, add firing ports, or a variety of other useful tools.

To enter upgrade mode, with the Hammer equipped, press "{1}". A ‘Hammer’ icon over a structure indicates which structure you will be upgrading. Press "{0}" to open the upgrade menu.

Trenches and Bunkers can be enhanced with reinforced wood, or eventually, Concrete.

Grab some materials from the storage container nearby. Add a door to the Bunker and upgrade your trenches to tier 2.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
First, build a fresh Trench and attach a Bunker.

Equip a hammer, then walk up to the Bunker. Facing the wall, press "{0}". 

You should see a menu with new options.

You can upgrade your Bunker in a variety of different ways. Convert it into AI defenses, add firing ports, or a variety of other useful tools.

To enter upgrade mode, with the Hammer equipped, press "{1}". A ‘Hammer’ icon over a structure indicates which structure you will be upgrading. Press "{0}" to open the upgrade menu.

Trenches and Bunkers can be enhanced with reinforced wood, or eventually, Concrete.

Grab some materials from the storage container nearby. Add a door to the Bunker and upgrade your trenches to tier 2.

HintText.SourceString: read about Upgrading and Modifying Trenches
HintText.LocalizedString: read about Upgrading and Modifying Trenches

BodyText.SourceString:
In order to make better use of your trenches, you will need to upgrade them to tier 3 or “Concrete” trenches. 

This requires a Concrete mixer, which must first be built at the Construction Yard. 

In order to power Bunker defences, you will need an Engine Room.

Engine Rooms require wooden Bunkers. 

You then must build pipes to support the desired structure.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
In order to make better use of your trenches, you will need to upgrade them to tier 3 or “Concrete” trenches. 

This requires a Concrete mixer, which must first be built at the Construction Yard. 

In order to power Bunker defences, you will need an Engine Room.

Engine Rooms require wooden Bunkers. 

You then must build pipes to support the desired structure.

HintText.SourceString: read about Power, Pipes and Concrete.
HintText.LocalizedString: read about Power, Pipes and Concrete.

BodyText.SourceString:
For training purposes, various watercraft have been provided for you to  practice basic driving controls and functionality. 

Use "{0}", "{1}", "{2}", "{3}" to control your vehicle just as you move on foot.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
For training purposes, various watercraft have been provided for you to  practice basic driving controls and functionality. 

Use "{0}", "{1}", "{2}", "{3}" to control your vehicle just as you move on foot.

BodyText.SourceString:
Field Artillery works largely the same as Emplaced Artillery

Refer to Artillery Basics tutorial for specifics.

The main difference is that Field Artillery can be manually moved when two players are mounted.

Field Artillery will not have as much range and power, but makes up for it in mobility.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Field Artillery works largely the same as Emplaced Artillery

Refer to Artillery Basics tutorial for specifics.

The main difference is that Field Artillery can be manually moved when two players are mounted.

Field Artillery will not have as much range and power, but makes up for it in mobility.

BodyText.SourceString:
Artillery and all indirect-fire weapons are affected by wind.

The power and direction of the wind will affect the trajectory and dispersion of each shot.

You can determine the wind’s direction by ‘standing flags’ on structures, such as the nearby radio towers, or by a player-deployed windsock.

The Wind's speed can be determined by how aggressively the flag flaps, or by the elevation of the windsock.

Test firing can be important for determining the current impact of wind on your bombardments.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Artillery and all indirect-fire weapons are affected by wind.

The power and direction of the wind will affect the trajectory and dispersion of each shot.

You can determine the wind’s direction by ‘standing flags’ on structures, such as the nearby radio towers, or by a player-deployed windsock.

The Wind's speed can be determined by how aggressively the flag flaps, or by the elevation of the windsock.

Test firing can be important for determining the current impact of wind on your bombardments.

BodyText.SourceString:
In Foxhole, most items, resources, and equipment are shared by thousands of others on your team.

By default, everything is public. However, to help larger groups plan, some specific structures, vehicles, or equipment can be reserved which temporarily restricts others from accessing them. 

Be aware that even reserved assets will eventually revert to public access over time.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
In Foxhole, most items, resources, and equipment are shared by thousands of others on your team.

By default, everything is public. However, to help larger groups plan, some specific structures, vehicles, or equipment can be reserved which temporarily restricts others from accessing them. 

Be aware that even reserved assets will eventually revert to public access over time.

BodyText.SourceString:
Structures and players can catch fire.

Prevent fires from spreading to other structures by dousing them with water. Equip a water bucket and fill it facing the water well, then press "{0}".

Aim the water bucket at the burning structure with "{1}", and throw it by clicking "{2}".
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Structures and players can catch fire.

Prevent fires from spreading to other structures by dousing them with water. Equip a water bucket and fill it facing the water well, then press "{0}".

Aim the water bucket at the burning structure with "{1}", and throw it by clicking "{2}".

HintText.SourceString: read about Fires and Water Buckets
HintText.LocalizedString: read about Fires and Water Buckets

BodyText.SourceString:
Facilities are player-constructed industrial bases used to produce specialized vehicles and equipment.

To begin, follow the Power Lines to the Power Plant and turn on the power by pressing "{0}" to open the menu.

Experiment with producing items in the various structures. Hover your mouse over the question-mark to learn more about each structure and the items it can produce. If a structure is not turning on, try mousing over the production toggle switch to get information about what is missing.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Facilities are player-constructed industrial bases used to produce specialized vehicles and equipment.

To begin, follow the Power Lines to the Power Plant and turn on the power by pressing "{0}" to open the menu.

Experiment with producing items in the various structures. Hover your mouse over the question-mark to learn more about each structure and the items it can produce. If a structure is not turning on, try mousing over the production toggle switch to get information about what is missing.

BodyText.SourceString:
This player-constructed Facility is connected to several Resource Mines. The Oil Well is connected to a pipe which will automatically move Oil into the refinery, and then to the power plant.

Start by accessing the Oil Well and starting an order for Oil. Set the order to Public using the drop-down menu in the top-left. This will put the Oil directly into the Pipe to the Oil Refinery.

See if you can figure out how to refine Oil and send it via Pipe to the Power Plant.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
This player-constructed Facility is connected to several Resource Mines. The Oil Well is connected to a pipe which will automatically move Oil into the refinery, and then to the power plant.

Start by accessing the Oil Well and starting an order for Oil. Set the order to Public using the drop-down menu in the top-left. This will put the Oil directly into the Pipe to the Oil Refinery.

See if you can figure out how to refine Oil and send it via Pipe to the Power Plant.

HintText.SourceString: learn about Pipes and Oil Wells
HintText.LocalizedString: learn about Pipes and Oil Wells

FlavourText.SourceString: Facility Vehicle Production and Small Trains
FlavourText.LocalizedString: Facility Vehicle Production and Small Trains

BodyText.SourceString:
Use this player-constructed Facility to produce a Small Train and place it on the tracks using the Crane. Use coal to fuel them.

You can connect Train cars to the engine by driving them close together and pressing "{0}" or "{1}" to open the context menu. To unlink them, use a wrench.

Try producing a train that can deliver Petrol to the Stationary Harvesters to run them, and also bring back the salvage that they produce.
BodyText.LocalizedString:
Use this player-constructed Facility to produce a Small Train and place it on the tracks using the Crane. Use coal to fuel them.

You can connect Train cars to the engine by driving them close together and pressing "{0}" or "{1}" to open the context menu. To unlink them, use a wrench.

Try producing a train that can deliver Petrol to the Facility Resource Mines to run them, and also bring back the salvage that they produce.

HintText.SourceString: learn about Facility Vehicle Production and Small Trains
HintText.LocalizedString: learn about Facility Vehicle Production and Small Trains
